intro: Cyphostemma nodiglandulosum, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds, and is characterized by its tendrils and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that give way to orange or red fruits resembling grapes. Its botanical features include distinctive glandular structures on the stems and leaves, which contribute to its scientific name. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some African cultures.
